definitions.definition: To emit sparks; to throw off ignited or incandescent particles
definitions.example: The wood was sparkling in the bonfire.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To shine as if throwing off sparks; to emit flashes of light; to scintillate; to twinkle
definitions.example: The stars sparkle in the sky.

definitions.definition: To manifest itself by, or as if by, emitting sparks; to glisten; to flash.
To emit little bubbles, as certain kinds of liquors; to effervesce
To emit in the form or likeness of sparks.
Act or appearance of something that sparkles; a sparkle; a gleam.
Of an object, reflecting light as if giving off tiny sparks.
Of a beverage, especially an alcoholic beverage, containing dissolved carbon dioxide (either naturally or that has been added) that comes out of solution in the form of many tiny bubbles.
